issue.title: Specified joint limits for electric joints in the Atlas V5 models are incorrect

content.raw:
@dljsjr thanks for sharing this data. I wonder how much these joint limits vary across robots? Should the joint limits be retracted even further as a safety factor? Food for thought.

I've made these changes to `atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf` in branch `issue_493` (b3369d5c5549). I based this branch off of a8ace4903b74 (the xacrogenization of `atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf`), so it doesn't have @tkoolen 's fixes to the arm kinematics. The branches will easily merge with each other though.

I've made these changes to atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf in branch issue_493 (b3369d5c5549). I based this branch off of a8ace4903b74 (the xacrogenization of atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf), so it doesn't have @tkoolen 's fixes to the arm kinematics.
